TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program 1.6: “To Vee or not To Vee” Grand Discussion Thread

Articles.Content:
2 minutes ago, theJesuit said:

No other mods - in regards with the landercan variant issue...  basically, have one or the other but not both!

with MM 3.1.2. and no KER it works.

with MM 3.1.2 with KER it doesn't work

with no MM 3.1.2 but with KER it works

Im running MM 3.1.0  with ker and everything, just fine in 1.6 tho

Last I'll post on this in case people are looking at it.  MM 3.1.0 (15 Oct 2018 on the MM Jenkins server) with KER 1.1.5.4 works okay.

Peace.

Sooooo... since the 'ol Poodle is totally redesigned to look radically different, is the "Mun or Bust" startup screen going to be updated to incorporate the new twin-bell design?

I loaded up the Kerbal X warhorse, and it was kind of a shock to see how different it was. I think the only other change since 0.20 was when 1.2 added a heatshield.

Tried 1.6 for a few minutes.

I'm going to vote against "new content" and for "fixing old bugs". Some of the bugs that were created in 1.4 are still present and we got some new highly objectionable bugs with 1.6

I'm sticking with 1.3.1

6 hours ago, nestor said:

If you look at the Stayputnik you have there two specular highlights. In the launchpad there is another light spot, if you try it somewhere else or in a different time of day that light spot won't be on.

 

 

Thanks for the reply. Do you happen to know the source of that second illumination, this is a bone stock install right at the start of Universal Time?

54 minutes ago, Poodmund said:

Thanks for the reply. Do you happen to know the source of that second illumination, this is a bone stock install right at the start of Universal Time?

Theres a light tower next to the pad vOv

I think Christmas came early.

Thanks for this gift (although I'd like to had have the option to use the old textures ... guess I have to make a backup of'em and mod'm in after the update)

Happy holidays to the team ... (or since it's likely that the whole team is actually Christian ... Merry Christmas)

Have fun (and I hope you get some free time to spend with your loved ones ... or at least your families) ... 

and happy new year (since I am unlikely to post ... and hopefully no one of you is forced to read posts)

8 hours ago, Cydonian Monk said:

Agree. 

Amusingly the solution for me was to buy a new Mac. Fresh install of the game and it ran normally/properly like everything else (though admitedly I still had to alt-click open the first time to get the "Yes, I really want to run this dangerous program downloaded from an unknown foreign entity" dialog).

Have you tried buying a new Mac?

If you don't want to plonk down $3k+ just to play the new version, I strongly suspect there's something in a ~/Library/ entry related to either Unity or Squad/KSP that's causing it. Ie: cache invalidation bug or somesuch. 

Or, you know, you could get a gaming PC for a thousand bucks and be done with it.

Hmmm...to update or wait...what a pickle this is...

lack of coliders on some parts..mysterious MM/KER issues by some..those new features sound really sweet tho!! Hmm..tomato or potato..

2 hours ago, Jesusthebird said:

Hmmm...to update or wait...what a pickle this is...

lack of coliders on some parts..mysterious MM/KER issues by some..those new features sound really sweet tho!! Hmm..tomato or potato..

Patience is a virtue.  I've been waiting since 1.3.1.

Lack of colliders should be weird, but this is KSP.  We've come to expect weird head scratchers in new updates.

I just launched a stripped of all mods game and found it so much more accessible with the DV readouts. I think the console crowd will be happy with this one.

And I like being able to retire a screen eating mod. 

(A radar altimeter would be a nice add though)
The settings.cfg created with a plain vanilla install from zip has a version of 1.5.0, not 1.6.0. Is there somewhere better to report this bug?

Or, you know, you could get a gaming PC for a thousand bucks and be done with it.

Why would anyone spend a thous...oh...right...I built my PC before the bitcoin hype train.

Hold on... You launched the update already? I thought it wasn't due 'till January...

 

And here we are, the (potentially) best update yet, releasing ahead of schedule (or so I presume).

 

Well, thank you all for your hard work, I look forward to trying it, and I hope you all have a wonderful, bug-free Christmas break!

WOAH! WAIT A MINUTE!

You changed the detail level on the adapters according to player feedback? They don't look like plate mail had a baby with a cheese grater anymore?

I...

I need to get to a doctor...

A question regarding the "reworked" parts...and a chance to show I know nothing about KSP . I have carried over saved ships and subassemblies since 1.3.1. Will these still work in 1.6 with it's parts?

I had just got around to upgrading to 1.5 (DL'ing, gathering mods for it, etc.)...you're killin' me, Smalls! I think I'll just carry on with 1.4 until my fave mods are updated.

Thanks gang!

3 minutes ago, Victor3 said:

A question regarding the "reworked" parts...and a chance to show I know nothing about KSP . I have carried over saved ships and subassemblies since 1.3.1. Will these still work in 1.6 with it's parts?

Yep.  In cases where the geometry was exactly the same, they will be swapped in place.  In cases where the geometry changed, your old versions will remain in game (and hidden) but you will have access to the new versions of the parts to use on future craft.

5 hours ago, T1mo98 said:

Or, you know, you could﻿ get a gaming PC for a thousand bucks and be done with it.

I have a PC as well. I'm not very fond of it (it's ugly, and noisy (I built it, myself, but the available choices for parts/cases doesn't escape ugly and noisy easily)).

 

6 hours ago, bonyetty said:

I am having trouble launching 1.6.0 Mac zip version. Is the installer the kerbal icon labeled launcher? It’s play button is greyed out when I open it. I tried moving KSP.osx locations as above but no luck. Any other suggestions to get 1.6 going on Mojave?

JUst up this thread are some answers from Squad that are not in the support forum at all regarding the issues with getting the Mac version to run. You, like me appear to have DLed the zip version---for good reason, since as far as any of us knew, the "Installer" has never worked, and so we never bothered to use it. It apparently actually works! Try DLing the installer and running that instead of the usual use of the zip file. Don't use the "Launcher" that's in the file structure, that doesn't work (I'm curious does it work for anyone?). Seems like a waste of 53MB of DL.

To be clear, go to the KSP Store, to your account, then under Kerbal Space Program, DL the "Installer (.pkg)" instead of the zip, and run that once it's downloaded.

SSDs because I don't even like the sound of a HD doing anything.

17 hours ago, Snark said:

If simply running Steam's "verify local files" function (or the moral equivalent on whatever download platform you're using) doesn't solve the problem for you... perhaps it may be worth running that and also deleting your PartDatabase.cfg file (from the root of your KSP folder) before re-starting KSP?

 

This solved it for me! Thanks!

Edited December 21, 2018 by Black-Two-
